conclusion: Number of turns of the coil N = 200
Area of the coil S = 1 m^2
Resistance of the coil r = 10 Ω
Magnetic field change with time as shown in Figure B

premise: The change in magnetic flux ΔΦ through the coil is given by ΔΦ = N ⋅ S ⋅ ΔB.

conclusion: From the graph, the rate of change of magnetic field ΔB/Δt = (0.4 - 0.2)/(4 - 0) = 0.05 T/s

premise: Induced EMF ε = N ⋅ S ⋅ ΔB/Δt
Total resistance in the circuit is R + r = 50 + 10 = 60 Ω
Using Ohm's Law, I = ε/(R + r)
Power P consumed by resistor R is given by P = I^2 ⋅ R
The maximum power consumed by R is 25/18 W
conclusion: The maximum power consumed by R is 25/18 W
